snippet: Baltasar Garzón told the Supreme Court on Wednesday that his decision to investigate killings committed during the Spanish Civil War had been motivated by “the helplessness of the victims.”
abstract: Baltasar Garzon, a high-profile Spanish judge, tells the Supreme Court that his decision to investigate killings committed during the Spanish Civil War was motivated by 'the helplessness of the victims'; his 2008 attempt to investigate killings from the war brought to a swift end because of the political controversy that it set off; right-wing groups started legal action against him, charging that he had overreached his authority and knowingly contravened a 1977 general amnesty that covers crimes perpetrated during the war.
lead_paragraph: Baltasar Garzón told the Supreme Court on Wednesday that his decision to investigate killings committed during the Spanish Civil War had been motivated by “the helplessness of the victims.”

headline.main: Spain: Judge Speaks at His Trial
